title: Kohen
summary: Kohen (Hebrew: כֹּהֵן‎' Cohen, [koˈ(h)en] "priest", pl. כֹּהֲנִים‎ Cohanim, [koˈ(h)anim] "priests") is the Hebrew word for "priest", used in reference to the Aaronic priesthood, also called Aaronides.[1] Levitical priests or kohanim are traditionally believed and halakhically required to be of direct patrilineal descent from the biblical Aaron (also Aharon), brother of Moses.[2]
